job_description: Software Validation Engineer - job post DGN Technologies South San Francisco, CA 94080 • Hybrid remote $80 - $120 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $80 - $120 an hour Job Type Contract Job Posting Title: Software Validation Engineer Employment Type: Contract Location: South San Francisco, CA (Hybrid) Experience at Sr. level is required. ● Accountable for understanding the functionality of the system, developing effective test strategies and plans, and executing testing procedures for strategic projects, maintenance and enhancements, and enterprise releases that impact ECDi systems ● Collaborate effectively to execute integration testing with other solution areas to release quality end to end products ● Actively be involved in the overall tester community to help drive process improvements and foster learning amongst team members ● Lead the portfolio’s testing activities and coordinate the testing resources ● Keep project management apprised of developments through clear and timely communication ● Provide inputs on project plans, review upstream deliverables, and fully execute the testing phase thru production support ● As a subject matter expert, collaborate with Project Managers, Business Systems Analysts, Developers, and Operations personnel to provide guidance on quality governance ● Lead the quality team through the development of SQA Test Plans, Test Procedures, SQA lab standards and tool requirements ● Manage work of onsite and offshore SQA testers ● Understand integrated solutions to determine impact of development activities ● Plan and execute functional testing on applications and systems using automation and manual testing Skills ● 5+ years of experience in software test planning and execution ● Ability to manage complex projects in a high-pressure, fast paced environment is required ● Experience in GxP validation and deliverables ● Agile and waterfall methodology experience preferred ● Working knowledge of SQA Tools: Code Coverage, Automation, Requirements and Test Case Management, Defect Tracking Experience ● Ability to create, read, and run queries, SQL procedures/scripts and perform data analysis to interpret results ● Experience with load performance measurement tools such as Silk Performer or Silk Test or Load Runner, WinRunner. ● Experience supporting delivery of enterprise solutions ● Experience in an integrated environments based upon platform software such as Solaris, Windows/Mac, Internet Information Server, Oracle, or SQL/Server ● Programming knowledge in one or major languages and/or scripting tools such as C, C++, Java, Visual Basic, JavaScript, Ruby. ● Understanding of leading tools and technologies for development of mission critical web, database and related applications. (Mercury Suite, Selenium, Segue, etc) ● Excellent customer facing and communication skills ● Strong experience leading testers both onsite and off shore ● Hands-on experience in authoring and executing manual test cases ● Strong process documentation skills ● Strong knowledge of software QA metrics, process performance/capability baseline and statistical techniques ● Excellent understanding of SDLC ● Self-driven and ability to work independently and interact with project teams ● A desire to learn and to explore new technologies and take on new challenges ● Background in a bio-pharma regulated environment with experiences in validation testing is a plus ● Experience with reporting analytics systems is a plus Education ● BS in Computer Science is preferred Job Type: Contract Pay: $80.00 - $120.00 per hour Benefits: Health insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: South San Francisco, CA 94080: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: Biotech/Healthcare: 5 years (Required) software test planning and execution: 5 years (Required) GxP validation: 5 years (Required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in South San Francisco, CA 94080 Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Validation Engineer - Infotainment - job post V2Soft 13 reviews Belmont, CA 94002 $60 - $80 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $60 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract Duties & Responsibilities - Plan, coordinate and execute laboratory and in-vehicle testing of Connected Infotainment systems and components. - Create and update test specifications and plans for laboratory and in-vehicle testing with focus on the U.S. market specifications. - Use logging equipment to document errors found during testing sessions - Cluster and categorize error patterns - Derive reproducibility of system malfunction - Pre-analyze system behavior and perform root-cause analysis - Execute error and bug-fix verification. - Prepare regular test status reports to communicate test and validation results to customers and VW Group partners using standardized systems for error reporting. - Establish and maintain an error-reporting database, cross-link objective quality results to other US/Canada specific test databases. - Update and maintain test setups (test-benches, in-vehicle systems, test equipment, etc.) - Prepare vehicles for test drives. - Build-up, package, and integrate new prototype components into cars. Required: o Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Science (Electrical/Electronic, Telecommunications, Automotive, Information Technologies) or equivalent. Valid CA Driver's License Desired: o Master’s degree in Engineering or Science (Electrical/Electronic, Telecommunications, Automotive, Information Technologies) or equivalent. o 3-4 years working experience with development teams in consumer level electronics, preferably Infotainment and/or telematics systems for an Automotive OEM or Tier-1 supplier. o Experience working on connected infotainment B2C, data packages and in app purchases. Job Type: Contract Salary: $60.00 - $80.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Belmont, CA 94002: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: connected infotainment: 3 years (Required) Automotive OEM or Tier-1: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Design Quality Control Engineer - job post Katalyst Healthcares & Life Sciences San Francisco, CA 94016 Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract Roles & Responsibilites: " Review and assess DHF and Design Control records to ensure compliance to the state-of-the-art design control requirements within ISO 13485, CFR 820 and IVDR (EU 2017/746). " Bring hands-on solutions and improvements to Design Control Records. " Create processes and process improvements to ensure consistent implementation of internal requirements and external laws, regulations, guidance's, and standards. " Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address QMS noncompliance and develop remediation plans. " Support the Organization to prepare Twist for external audits, drive compliance. " Support as needed Customer feedback and Corrective actions from customer audits. " Provide training and structure as needed for key Design Control (ISO 13485, CFR 820) elements. " As needed, QA representative on Core Teams for ISO 13485 or FDA regulated products " Define the requirements to establish a "Best-in-Class cGMP workflow to manufacture IVD products " Collaborate with Regulatory and Quality Assurance to define requirements for implementing ISO-13485, IVDR, FDA Part 820, Harmonized Standards, and guidance from Competent Authorities & Notified Bodies " Generate, edit, and maintain QMS documentation, including but not limited to, global/departmental policies, procedures, work instructions, forms, templates, and training materials " As needed Collaborate with the development of Technical Documentation for EU IVDR submission " Follow regulatory and ISO 13485 requirements " Maintains strong communication network with peers. " Demonstrated effective knowledge of use of various computer systems. " Additional responsibilities as assigned. " Ability to travel 10% " Review verification and validation reports and identify gaps for compliance to internal quality requirements. Education & Experience: " Bachelor's degree in a scientific or engineering discipline, plus a minimum of 3 years of work experience in quality engineering or equivalent work required. " Advanced experience within ISO 13485 and CFR 820 Design Control requirements, ie design inputs, outputs, traceability, and DHF requirements. " Familiarity with regulatory requirements for IVD Products, ISO 13485, 21CFR820, IVDR, applicable experience in medical device, or biotech manufacturing and a thorough knowledge and understanding of cGMP. " Previous experience as a Design Core Team representative responsible for the execution of design control requirements, product life cycle management. " Led efforts to ensure usability needs, input /output requirements, traceability as well as verification and validation records are recorded per regulations with applicable DHF's. " Familiar with ISO 14971 to the degree to ensure compliance throughout the QMS lifecycle. " Experience in Pharmaceutical, NGS, and/or Molecular Diagnostic a plus If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

BS in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, STEM or Quality related education or a similar engineering discipline required, Master's degree preferred.
